questions.question_text: Your organization wants to grant Google Vault access to an external regulatory authority. In an effort to comply with an investigation, the external group needs the ability to view reports in Google Vault. What should you do?

choices.C: Assign an Archived User license to the external users.
choices.A: Create accounts for external users and assign Vault privileges.
choices.D: Temporarily assign the super admin role to the users.
choices.B: Share Vault access with external users.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
It's interesting that folks pushing for both A and B are citing the same relevant https://support.google.com/vault/answer/3338258. B is not incorrect, but A is the better answer if you read that Google KB carefully.

Selected Answer: B
B:https://support.google.com/vault/answer/3338258?hl=en

comments.content:
James, lendo a URL apontada, perceba que existe uma indicação que conduz para a resposta A:
Your Google Workspace administrator must first add these users to your organization in the Admin console and give them privileges to search in Vault, view reports, or other tasks

discussion.content:
B:
https://support.google.com/vault/answer/3338258?hl=en

Selected Answer: A
A. Create accounts for external users and assign Vault privileges.

comments.content: That's the idea so that the site doesn't get taken down. Read the discussion to get the correct answer from the community

B is the correct Answer!
To grant Google Vault access to an external regulatory authority, you should share Vault access with the external users. Google Vault provides the ability to share access to specific searches, holds, and exports with external users for compliance and investigation purposes.

Selected Answer: A
I believe it's A

Selected Answer: A
A - Your Google Workspace administrator must first add these users to your organization in the Admin console and give them privileges to search in Vault, view reports, or other tasks. You must then inform the external users that they can access Vault with those accounts.

choices.C: Configure an Apple Push Certificate, and be sure to use a work address that can be accessed in the future.
choices.A: Follow the prompts under "company owned devices," and select "iOS Management." Select the option to "enforce management on iOS devices."
choices.B: Configure an Apple Push Certificate, and select "certificate never expires."
choices.D: In the Admin console, navigate to iOS management, and enable the Apple Push Certificate connector.

questions.question_text: Your organization has enabled spoofing protection against unauthenticated domains. You are receiving complaints that email from multiple partners is not being received. While investigating this issue, you find that emails are all being sent to quarantine due to the configured safety setting. What should be the next step to allow uses to review these emails and reduce the internal complaints while keeping your environment secure?

choices.D: Change the spoofing protection to deliver the emails to inboxes with a custom warning instead of quarantining them.
choices.C: Add your partner sending IP addresses to an allowlist.
choices.B: Change the spoofing protection to deliver the emails to spam instead of quarantining them.
choices.A: Add your partner domains IPs to the Inbound Gateway setting.

comments.content: C: Users may complain that legitimate emails are landing in their spam folders, requiring them to manually move them to the inbox. Forcing over 10k users to create Gmail filters would be inconvenient. The best approach is to minimize the impact on the user experience.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
correct answer - B

Selected Answer: D
spoofing protection

Selected Answer: C
emails delivered successfully without triggering the spoofing protection rules. allows the emails to bypass quarantine while still keeping your environment secure by only permitting emails from trusted sources. B is not correct because it doesn't resolve the root issue and spam folder is easily ignored by employees

Selected Answer: B
B is the only way. Adding it to the bypass list doesn't have an impact on the safety settings.

Selected Answer: C
C, send to spam is not safety, and the complaint will not reduce

C: Users may complain that legitimate emails are landing in their spam folders, requiring them to manually move them to the inbox. Forcing over 10k users to create Gmail filters would be inconvenient. The best approach is to minimize the impact on the user experience.

Selected Answer: B
B. Change the spoofing protection to deliver the emails to spam instead of quarantining them.

Selected Answer: B
correct answer - B
B. Change the spoofing protection to deliver the emails to spam instead of quarantining them.

Correct answer is - C :
**I got wrong the past one, is not A**
¨Add IP addresses to allowlists in Gmail

Help prevent messages from certain IP addresses from being marked as spam by adding them to an email allowlist. Messages from these addresses won't be marked as spam by Gmail.

Email allowlists are always applied to your entire domain. You can’t create email allowlists that apply to specific organizational units only.

IP addresses of your mail servers that are forwarding email to Gmail should be added to Inbound Gateway and not in IP allowlist¨

https://support.google.com/a/answer/60751?hl=en

Correct answer is - A :

¨Add IP addresses to allowlists in Gmail

Help prevent messages from certain IP addresses from being marked as spam by adding them to an email allowlist. Messages from these addresses won't be marked as spam by Gmail.

Email allowlists are always applied to your entire domain. You can’t create email allowlists that apply to specific organizational units only.

IP addresses of your mail servers that are forwarding email to Gmail should be added to Inbound Gateway and not in IP allowlist¨

comments.content: It says multiple partners : adding them to allowlist is not a good solution

discussion.content: Selected Answer: B Quarantine action: When you select Quarantine for any of the advanced security settings, the quarantine you select applies only to incoming messages. This is true even when the quarantine you select specifies actions to take on outgoing messages. Warning banners: Warning banners (yellow box) appear only in Gmail web. Other spam settings: These advanced security features work independently of other spam settings you might have previously turned on. For example, even if you've listed a domain as a safe sender in spam settings, the enhanced security features are still applied. https://support.google.com/a/answer/9157861?hl=en#:~:text=Move%20email%20to,with%20this%20action.

Selected Answer: C
la respuesta es C: https://support.google.com/a/answer/60751?hl=en&sjid=14509679687775256174-SA

Selected Answer: B
B, the key thing is letting the user review but remain secure.

Selected Answer: D
Users don't look at spam. The custom warning label is much more functional in the real world
Users don't look at spam. The custom warning label is much more functional in the real world.

Selected Answer: B
B. Change the spoofing protection to deliver the emails to spam instead of quarantining them.

Selected Answer: B
Messages that aren’t authenticated with DMARC by the receiving server are sent to the recipient’s spam folder. If the receiving mail server has a quarantine configured, messages might be sent to quarantine, not directly to the recipient’s spam folder.

D is not correct because there is no custom warning
C would keep the complaints ongoing
A would still process those messages for spam/spoofing checks and thus quarantine them 
C is the only solution in my opinion

The correct answer is B.
The D one is not correct because it states "custom warning message": you cannot customize the warning message for the Advanced Phishing and Malware Protection section in the Admin console.

Selected Answer: B
Choose B
Why is not D?

Selected Answer: A
They need to be able to review these mails, so I would think the mails need to end up in their inbox: A or D then. 
Since with D all mail with SPF / DMARC issues will end up in inbox with custom message (does not sound safe) so I would follow Jaxclain and go with A

Selected Answer: B
I changed my mind lol is B

Selected Answer: B
B: to spam gives user option to review and organization stays secure.

Selected Answer: A
I would say A is correct, setting an inbound mail gateway will bypass the SPF / DMARC checks and this resolves the issue and it will keep the environment secure from being spoofed: 

Option C wont work.
Option B makes no sense to send those emails to spam? why would you send those emails to spam, Google never recommends this kind of path.
Option D, could be ok but again, there is no need to modify the Spoofing protection.

comments.content: Ok after reviewing again this question, I believe the correct answer is B lol makes no sense to send those emails to spam but indeed it says allow users to review the emails so it has to be spam so is up to them to move those emails to the inbox or not.

They say "to allow uses to review these emails " (I assume they mean users).
Review? do they mean view? if they mean review maybe they mean Option D?

choices.D: Build an application that will fetch updated data from the HRIS system via Open API, and then update Google Workspace with the Directory API accordingly.
choices.B: Modify the GCDS configuration to use the HRIS application as the data source and complete any necessary adjustments.
choices.A: Set up Azure AD and federate on-premises AD with it. Provision user accounts from Azure AD with the Google-recommended process.
choices.C: Export HRIS data to a CSV file every day, and build a solution to define the delta with the previous day; import the result as a CSV file via the Admin console.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Ignore everyone saying D, these people are just choosing ChatGPT answers over and over again despite it being 2 years outdated and no knowledge of the present exam or current google workspace

comments.content: Also I really don't think they expect you to be able to build applications to be a Google Workspace Admin, B is the only reasonable option

You could post some meaningful links instead of saying these unhelpful words, I checked the documentation and didn't see that GCDS can sync from this type of data source, I'll vote D, even I thought this question was bad.
I am not quite sure if we can go through API control with OpenAI under AppAccess Control, if so,maybe B will do

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Could be possible that HRIS store information in LDAP database and can use GCDS to sync users?

Selected Answer: D
I have not seen GCDS working with SaaS on the cloud before, It supports LDAP only.

Selected Answer: B
Voting B and I agree with bobsmith69 (lol) below. D is unrealistic for most administrators and doesn't align with the goal of simplifying the provisioning process. B is the most practical and straightforward approach. GCDS is designed to synchronize user data, and since the HRIS system offers integration options, you can likely adapt GCDS to pull data from it instead of Active Directory.

Selected Answer: D
D. Build an application that will fetch updated data from the HRIS system via Open API, and then update Google Workspace with the Directory API accordingly.

comments.content: Isso ai, uma vez que a ideia é "remover" a dependência do AD

discussion.content: B is the answer as it is the most simple and answers the 2 requirement. D maybe an answer but it requires another 3rd party dependency even if you develop it.

Selected Answer: D
Vote D. Why not B? Because:
1. HRIS offers integration via CSV export and Open API standard, whereas GCDS only supports LDAP to sync.
https://support.google.com/a/answer/106368?hl=en&ref_topic=2679497&sjid=5054427946360089599-AP
2. GCDS Configuration Manager does not have CSV import or Open API option
https://support.google.com/a/answer/6162412?sjid=5054427946360089599-AP
A: No. Not relevant and no additional 3rd party service.
C: No. Must be automated from beginning to end.

Selected Answer: D
Option D involves building a custom application that integrates with the HRIS system using the Open API standard to fetch updated user data. The custom application can then use the Google Workspace Directory API to update user accounts in Google Workspace accordingly. This approach allows for complete automation from beginning to end and ensures that user provisioning is not tied to on-premises AD or any third-party service.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
everything needs to be automatic

questions.question_text:
Your organization is planning to remove any dependencies on Active Directory (AD) from all Cloud applications they are using. You are currently using Google Cloud Directory Sync (GCDS) with on-premises AD as a source to provision user accounts in Google Workspace. Your organization is also using a software-as-a-service (SaaS) human resources information system (HRIS) that offers integration via CSV export and Open API standard.

Additional requirements for the solution include:

• It should not require a subscription to any additional third-party service.
• The process must be automated from beginning to end.

You are tasked with the design and implementation of a solution to address user provisioning with these requirements.

What solution should you implement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Locate the Meet quality tool, and review the output for issues with quality.

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C. "Use the Meet quality tool (MQT) to troubleshoot your organization’s Google Meet meetings and identify the root cause of issues."

A. Troubleshooting organizer bandwithd is doesn't make sense because multiple users across the organization are experiencing the issue
B. There is no Meet quality tool pushable to user devices
D. There is no streaming setting in Admin console
C, Airebyc's answer is ChatGPT nonsense you can't push the tool locally

Selected Answer: C
C Only

Selected Answer: B
B. Push the Meet quality tool to end user devices and run local reports to determine connectivity issues.

The most effective way to start troubleshooting video degradation in Google Meet calls is to use the Meet quality tool. By pushing the Meet quality tool to end user devices and running local reports, you can gather data about the connectivity, network conditions, and performance on the user's end. This will help you identify potential issues related to the user's network setup, bandwidth, and other factors that could be contributing to the video degradation.

Selected Answer: C
I believe it's C. You can't push it locally

questions.question_text: Multiple users across the organization are experiencing video degradation in Meet video calls. As an administrator, what steps should you take to start troubleshooting?

choices.A: Troubleshoot network bandwidth for the organizer of the meeting.
choices.D: Update the Admin Console Meet settings to disable streaming.
choices.C: Locate the Meet quality tool, and review the output for issues with quality.
choices.B: Push the Meet quality tool to end user devices and run local reports to determine connectivity issues.
